item.description:
Just because we postponed the Liberty & Webster Cliff hikes for this coming weekend, doesn't mean we're not hiking this coming weekend... in fact, quite the opposite. We are!!! And we're "BIG TIMING IT" to boot!!!!

Join us as we take on two of what often seems to be the most talked about, the most majestic, the most anticipated, annnnd the most mysterious of all the summits in the Southern Whites. JOIN US AS WE TAKE ON...

The Tripyramid Mastiffs!!!

Did I say, Mastiffs??? I meant massifs!!!


...join us as we take on two of what often seems to be the most anticipated, majestic, mysterious, annnnd talked about summits of the Southern Whites... The Tripyramid Massifs!!!

 

About The Hike

We've planned an "out and back," beginning at the Pine Bend Brook Trail trailhead, from which we will pass the Scaur Ridge Trail (on our right), cross over the North Peak, hike along the Mt Tripyramid Trail, and pass the Sabbaday Brook Trail (on our left), all while on our way to Middle Tripyramid. Once on Middle Tri, we'll turn on our toes and retrace our steps, by way of butt, sled or sole.

Along the way, expect to encounter a number of streams, that during this time of year may require a rock hop or two, steep steeps and softening snow. Should the weather remain cold and not slip above freezing, the trail may just gift us with only a few slick spots and an abundance of well-packed snow. But should the weather turn warm, we may find ourselves walking in soppy snow that may require snowshoes to keep us from postholing.

All in all, this should turn out to be quite the hike as it takes us over two of New Hampshire's 48 4000 footers, presents us with a few stunning views of the Sandwich Range and one of our last remaining looks at this year's snow covered mountains. We hope you can join in the fun.

Note: We will pay close attention to weather and trail conditions, and should there be any adverse weather, such as high winds at the summit or an approaching storm, or should trail conditions prove to be more difficult than anticipated, it may be necessary for us to avoid the summits, alter our plans, and/or cancel the hike altogether.

Also... seeing that we'll most likely encounter open flowing water, please make sure you have an extra pair of socks and a second pair of pants should there be an unforeseen fall.


EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST
(gear must be winter weather tested)

Cold Weather/Winter Essentials (required):
• Synthetic or Wool Wicking Underpant & Undershirt
• Mid-layer Synthetic or Wool Insulating Pant & Shirt
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket and/or Vest
• Windproof/Waterproof Shell w/hood & Pant
• Synthetic or Wool Sock Liners (wicking layer)
• Synthetic or Wool Socks (insulating layer)
• Sturdy Hiking Boots (waterproof & insulated)
• Hat & Gloves
• Balaclava
• Goggles
• Extra Insulating Layers (pant & top)
• Extra pair of Socks, Hat & Gloves
• Water (min. 2L) - in a wide-mouthed bottle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Headlamp/Flashlight (w/ fresh lithium batteries)
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's no reason not to carry one)
• MICROspikes or mountaineering crampons
• Snowshoes
• Gaiters

the Remaining Essentials:
• Medication/First Aid Supplies*
• Hand Warmers
• Sleeping Bag & Pad*
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter/Bivy*
• Stove*
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:
• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellent/Toiletries
• Trekking Poles (very helpful when using snowshoes; very helpful when not using snowshoes)
• Camera/Binoculars

* To Be Carried Among The Group

LET'S NOT UNDERESTIMATE ANYTHING; come prepared for the worst... cold temps., snowy weather, high winds and darkness.
ALSO... TAKE NOTE: the "Optional" list is significantly smaller than at any other time of year

Directions

From I-93 take Exit 32 (Lincoln/Kancamagus Hwy Exit). Turn left (east) and follow Route 112E for approx. 19 miles.

From the intersection of NH Route 16 & 112, follow 112W for approximately 16.5 of a miles.

Parking is roadside, located about 7 miles east of the hairpin turn, and 1 mile west of Sabbaday Falls Parking Area. Again, there is no parking lot at the Pine Bend Brook Trail trailhead, only roadside, so be sure your car is completely off of the highway.

Google Maps: http://maps.google.com/maps...
Coordinates: 44.001984, -71.413279


Additional Information

North Tripyramid: 4180 feet
Middle Tripyramid: 4140 feet
Total elevation gain: approx. 3200 feet

Distance from Trailhead to North Peak: 4.0 miles
Distance from North to Middle Peak: 0.8 miles
Total distance: 9.6 miles

Exposure: Moderate
Difficulty: Moderate/Strenuous
Pace: Moderate

Sunrise: ? AM
Sunset: ? PM

Approx. High Temp: ?
Approx. Low Temp: ?

Extended AccuWeather Forecast:
http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/lincoln-nh/03251/daily-weather-forecast/2174585

7-Day National Weather Forecast (NOAA):
http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php...

6-Day Mountain-Forecast.com:
http://www.mountain-forecast.com/peaks/Mount-Tripyramid-New-Hampshire/forecasts/1275

Mt. Washington Observatory Higher Summits Forecast:
http://www.mountwashington.org/weather/summit_forecast.php

Weather & Trail Conditions (AMC):
http://www.outdoors.org/recreation/tripplanner/go/backcountry-weather.cfm

Weather & Trail Conditions (TrailsNH):
http://trailsnh.com/New-Hampshire-4000-Footers.php

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: From I-93 Exit 32, follow Kancamagus Hwy east for approx. 19 miles; From NH Rt 16, follow the K Hwy west for approx. 16.5 miles; Parking is roadside. Coordinates: 44.001984, -71.413279; Cell: 860-460-1500
item.name: The Tripyramids
